Package org.example.lab.agh

Interface Map<K,V>

Type Parameters:
K - the type of keys maintained by this map
V - the type of mapped values
All Known Implementing Classes:
MyMap
public interface Map<K,V>
The Map interface represents a mapping of keys to values. It provides methods to add, remove, and retrieve key-value pairs.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    contains(K key)
    Checks if the specified key exists in the map.
    V
    get(K key)
    Retrieves the value associated with the specified key, or null if the key does not exist.
    List<K>
    keys()
    Returns a list of all keys in the map.
    boolean
    put(K key, V value)
    Adds an element to the map under the specified key.
    boolean
    remove(K key)
    Removes the specified key and its associated value from the map.

  • Method Details

    • put

      boolean put(K key, V value)
      Adds an element to the map under the specified key. If the key already exists, the method should replace the value.
      Parameters:
      key - the key (not null)
      value - the value associated with the key (not null)
      Returns:
      true if the element was successfully added, false otherwise

    • remove

      boolean remove(K key)
      Removes the specified key and its associated value from the map.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the key was successfully removed, false otherwise

    • get

      V get(K key)
      Retrieves the value associated with the specified key, or null if the key does not exist.
      Parameters:
      key - the key (not null)
      Returns:
      the value associated with the key, or null if the key does not exist

    • keys

      List<K> keys()
      Returns a list of all keys in the map.
      Returns:
      a java.util.List of keys

    • contains

      boolean contains(K key)
      Checks if the specified key exists in the map.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to check for
      Returns:
      true if the key exists, false otherwise
